page.title: 05Chickney plant life, ecology
page.content: The 6 small woods and spinneys in the area contain most of the broad leaved trees common to the English landscape; oak, ash, beech, hornbeam, sycamore, & chestnut. Beneath these are elderberry & hazel; & on the woodland floor, bramble,dog mercury & bluebells.Hedges in the area range from well kept to straggly & poorly cut.The predominan species is hawthorn but other plants have invaded such as hazel, sloe, field maple, briar rose & bramble.With the field headland now being left unploughed wild flowers flourish. In September,scabious,knapweed,dog daisy, convolvulus, poppies, nipplewort, hemlock, ragwort, speedwell, wild pansies & yarrow were in bloom. The now defunct railway line has been left as game bird cover, & here rose bird willow herb flowered profusely. All elms suffered from Dutch Elm disease.
